highlights: Campaign adopts Skill Column advancement rules (no pyramid reshaping required)
Significant Milestone skill point can raise any skill by +1 within current cap
Insaerndel uses banked Significant Milestone to advance Contacts from Average to Fair
Athletics remains at Fair (+2) - no demotion required under column rules
Rules documentation updated to explain column advancement in fate_core_skyrim.md

data/rules/fate_core_skyrim.md.change: Added clarification: 'This campaign uses Skill Column advancement: you may raise any one skill by +1 without reshaping other skills; the only limit is the current skill cap.'
data/rules/fate_core_skyrim.md.rationale: Eliminates pyramid maintenance complexity and allows more flexible character growth

data/pcs/pc_insaerndel.json.milestone_used: Significant Milestone (banked from Battle of Whiterun resolution)
data/pcs/pc_insaerndel.json.advancement_method: Column advancement: Contacts raised from Average (+1) to Fair (+2)

gm_notes: Column advancement rule allows skills to be raised without requiring pyramid reshaping
This change resolves potential confusion about whether Athletics needs to be demoted when Contacts is raised
Under column rules, the character can have multiple skills at the same rank without strict pyramid enforcement
The only limit is the current skill cap (typically +4 at character creation, can increase with Major Milestones)
This makes Significant Milestones more impactful and character growth more flexible
Insaerndel's skill distribution after advancement: 1 Great, 2 Good, 4 Fair, 3 Average
While this breaks the strict Fate Core pyramid (1/2/3/4), column advancement is a common Fate variant
Future skill advances will continue to use column rules rather than pyramid maintenance
This patch documents the campaign's explicit adoption of column advancement as the canonical rule

design_notes.why_column_advancement: Column advancement reduces bookkeeping and allows more organic character growth
design_notes.skill_cap_enforcement: The current cap remains Great (+4) until a Major Milestone raises it to Superb (+5) or higher
design_notes.pyramid_vs_column: Column advancement is more forgiving and commonly used in Fate campaigns with extended play
design_notes.backward_compatibility: Previous milestone expenditures remain valid; this clarifies future advancement rules
